sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The vvandering virgin: or, The coy lass well fitted. Virgins whoae coyness & disdain does prove the fatal ruine of cemented love, learn, and beware, lest you like me cry out I'le find my love, or search the world about to the tune of, Cloris awake, or The loving chambermaid.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at Golden Ball in West Smithfield., [London] : [1672]
Verse: "You virgins so pretty ..." In two parts. Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
=======
The vvandering virgin: or, The coy lass well fitted. Virgins whoae coyness & disdain does prove the fatal ruine of cemented love, learn, and beware, lest you like me cry out I'le find my love, or search the world about to the tune of, Cloris awake, or The loving chambermaid.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at Golden Ball in West Smithfield., [London] : [1672]
Verse: "You virgins so pretty ..." In two parts. Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
P[hilip]. Brooksby
Golden Ball in West Smithfield.
